intro: Cacalia arborea, commonly known as the tree cacalia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Cacalia arborea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
